channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024040697
item.description:
Report X-2024040697

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed the corners of box were wet. Box was placed in a tote and sent to QA for inspection. QA placed in a salvage drum ASAP. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the bottles is leaking from the cap when turned upside down. The cap is still sealed to bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright in a lines tote. It was then sent to QQ, where it was placed upright in a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040391
item.description:
Report X-2024040391

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fully regulated hazmat package containing 4 plastic one gallon of hydrogen peroxide. The box was wet and torn from one gallon that had its cap nearly off and spilled most of liquid inside plastic bag it was sealed in. Other 3 gallons are stained from spill but did not seem to spill themselves. DescribePack: Box was wet and torn up, mostly on the bottom and right side of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent pads inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040390
item.description:
Report X-2024040390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A large fully regulated hazmat pail. Hazmat was being loaded when it was dropped and caused a huge dent on top of the drum. The hazmat started spilling out methanol from the dented area that caused a tear/puncture. This hazmat is not safe to transport. DescribePack: Hazmat pail sustained a large dent and caused a tear around 4 to 5 inches long. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent pads inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040343
item.description:
Report X-2024040343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET AND TORN WHILE UNLOADING. ONE UNLOADER GOT SUBSTANCE ON SKIN; THEY FLUSHED SKIN WITH WATER AND WERE FIRST-AID TREATED. UPON INSPECTION, ONE BOTTLE HAD LEAKED FROM CAP COMING OFF. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE NEUTRALIZED AND ABSORBED. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM CAP COMING OFF. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: AFFECTED EMPLOYEE FLUSHED SKIN WITH WATER AND WAS FIRST-AID TREATED. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE NEUTRALIZED AND ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2024040216
item.description:
Report X-2024040216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: EAST ALTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES FROM THE USA TO AUSTRALIA WERE INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF ODOR BOMB CAR DEODORIZERS IN EACH PACKAGE. TRACKING NUMBER 1Z978293DG30129039 CONTAINED (15) 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS. TRACKING NUMBER 1Z978293DG32078644 CONTAINED (25) 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 978293, PAUL KELLER, 925 E EDWARDSVILLE RD, WOOD RIVER IL 62095-1823.

item.title: Report E-2024040290
item.description:
Report E-2024040290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: JOLIET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported 1 gallon of UN 3265 "Pantastic" released from 4-1-gallon plastic jugs impacting the trailer floor due to improper loading by the shipper. Due to the corrosive nature ERTS determined a contractor's assistance would be required. Hepaco arrived on site and found the terminal had placed soda ash on the spill. They pH tested the area and cleaned the impacted area with absorbents. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum with the damaged bottles and spent absorbent were left on site.

item.title: Report E-2024040260
item.description:
Report E-2024040260

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of phosphoric acid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. E3+ personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. The pallet was disassembled and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of phosphoric acid was overpacked in one (1) 85-gallon drum. All spent absorbents and impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. The three (3) waste drums were staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040254
item.description:
Report E-2024040254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, nine (9) 1-quart containers of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. ed 1-quart containers of paint (UN1263) and containerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. HCE personnel utilized absorbent wipes to collect all released paint (UN1263) from the impacted surfaces of the trailer. All paint (UN1263) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon poly container that were staged on-site in RLC's consolidated waste area.

item.title: Report E-2024040171
item.description:
Report E-2024040171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal. HCE personnel repalletized the undamaged freight for shipping to its destination.

item.title: Report E-2024040125
item.description:
Report E-2024040125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 15, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel removed the damaged pails and overpacked them in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized absorbent pads to further remove any paint and contained all spent absorbents in the same (1) 55-gallon drum.
